column1: One day he had gone beyond any point which he had ever before visited. He traveled through an open wood
column2: which enabled him to see a great distance. At length he beheld a light breaking through the foliage of the distant trees
column3: which made him sure that he was on the borders of a prairie. It was a wide plain
column5: and enameled with flowers of a thousand lovely tints.After walking for some time without a path
column8: he suddenly came to a ring worn among the grass and the flowers
column9: as if it had been made by footsteps moving lightly round and round. But it was strange—so strange as to cause the White Hawk to pause and gaze long and fixedly upon the ground—there was no path which led to this flowery circle. There was not even a crushed leaf nor a broken twig
